title: Correct singularization for words like 'reserves' and 'nerves'
body: Inflector no longer singularizes words like 'reserves' and 'nerves' to 'reserfs' and 'nerfs'.

title: Refactored class_attribute.
body: class_attribute now uses ruby instance vars rather than redefining the value as a method. Also added a new option allowing for the value to not be persisted on inheritance, that option defaults to true (does persist).

title: Extract method refactoring in ActionDispatch::Routing.
body: Another small win.

title: Add migration examples to Association Basics
body:
When I help newcomers to Rails with Associations I often find they forget to build in the foreign key in their migrations. I'm wondering if it would be helpful to include example migrations for each type of association. I know the images imply the need to build in the foreign key but I think an actual migration would be more explicit. What do you guys think?

Thanks for all that you do!

title: dump schema.rb without :version option
body: Fix issue where schema.rb has incompatible :version option.

title: Support MyISAM FULLTEXT and SPATIAL indexes
body:
I had opened #8239, and @rafaelfranca pointed out that it was related to #6101.

I took that pull request as a base, and adjusted it to add support for different index types.

In order to cleanly separate the `type` and `using` parts, I changed the syntax of the API for the type to be `:using => 'btree'` instead of `:type => 'btree'`.

When combined with #8242, it Rails will be fully compatible with MyISAM specific indexing features, of `FULLTEXT` and `SPATIAL` indexes.

Please let me know if there are any changes you want me to make.  Thanks.

title: Revert turbolinks load order requirement
body:
As of Turbolinks 0.6.1, the turbolinks script doesn't need to be last in the manifest.  

Reverts the change made in #8411.

title: Add ENV['RACK_ENV'] support to rake runner/console/server.
body:
`rake dbconsole` support ENV['RACK_ENV']. And `railties/lib/rails.rb` also support one.

```ruby
 87     def env
 88       @_env ||= begin
 89         ENV["RAILS_ENV"] ||= ENV["RACK_ENV"] || "development"
 90         ActiveSupport::StringInquirer.new(ENV["RAILS_ENV"])
 91       end
 92     end
```

I thinks we should use RACK_ENV  for usefulness and consistency.

title: fix warning: possibly useless use of a constant in void context
Replace comments' non-breaking spaces with spaces
body:
Sometimes, on Mac OS X, programmers accidentally press Option+Space
rather than just Space and don’t see the difference. The problem is
that Option+Space writes a non-breaking space (0XA0) rather than a
normal space (0x20).

This commit removes all the non-breaking spaces inadvertently
introduced in the comments of the code.

title: Cleaning up a few lines
body: Refactored some unnecessary '? true : false' statements and fixed a few spacing issues

title: Fixing a spelling mistake
body: This pull request contains the fix for a slight spelling mistake in guides/source/active_model_basics.md b/guides/source/active_model_basics.md.

title: Fix #8414. Performance problem with postgresql adapter primary_key function.
body:
According to @mccuskk, primary_key method in PostgreSQLAdapter execute slow query when we have many schemas. And if we use pg_constraint , we haven't to use pg_depend table to filter with table name.

Please see #8414.

title: pg_namespace table isn't used.
body:
When investigating #8414, I found a bit strange sql.
In this sql, pg_namespace (a.k.a. name) isn't joined other table.

If we want to use cross join, I'm wrong.

title: backport #8403, no intermediate AR objects when eager loading.
body:
This is a backport of #8403.
It fixes the issue described in #3313

Conflicts:

	activerecord/CHANGELOG.md
	activerecord/test/models/developer.rb

I had to make some modifications to the spec because the API changed in 4.0.

title: Extract method refactoring.
body: Simple, straightforward refactoring complete with little green dots!

title: Locate `=require turbolinks` at the bottom of application.js
body: Turbolinks should be located at the bottom of application.js to detect assets change properly.

title: ActiveModel SecurePassword cost factor for BCrypt
body:
ActiveModel::SecurePassword currently has a class method #min_cost that is used to set a boolean value to change the cost factor of bcrypt-ruby to either 4 (MIN_COST of bcrypt-ruby) or 10 (DEFAULT in bcrypt-ruby).

If you want to have more fine-grained control over the cost factor you need to override the #password= method of the SecurePassword module with your own model that is using has_secure_password. 

This PR removes the #min_cost class method and replaces it with a #cost class method which takes an integer.  A developer can then set this class method to a specific value is required by their application by doing:

```ruby
  class User < ActiveRecord::Base
    has_secure_password
    ActiveModel::SecurePassword.cost = 15
  end
```

#cost maintains the same behavior of #min_cost where it is set to the MIN_COST during tests and defaults to bcrypt-ruby's DEFAULT value. 

I personally like having a bit more control over the hash stretches for when I need it, in a simple class setter method instead of override an instance method. 

However, I feel like this is the middle of the road solution. I think a better implementation would be:

```ruby
  class User < ActiveRecord::Base
    has_secure_password cost: 15
  end
```

#has_secure_password class method already has support for hash parameters (validations), so adding another key/value for cost is trivial. 

Secondly, I think it would be better to set the min_cost and default_cost using bcrypt-ruby's constants instead of integers as I did in this implementation. 

I'm opening this PR to show what I've added and start the conversation on what I think would be the better implementation. I don't want to go too far down the road if the Core/Others feel this isn't the right direction.  Thanks!

title: Fix wrong doc and message about rails profiler.
body: According to edge rails's implementation, it seems that these doc and message are wrong.

title: ActionView::Template#refresh fails to reload the template to render the error
body:
Sorry, I messed up with previous issue (#8383) by submitting pull-request on the wrong base :(

I'm trying to render a json/jbuilder template inside of a regular html template. Here is the code of the helper I'm using

```ruby
def get_some_json_stuff
   render partial: 'my_json_partial', handler: [:jbuilder], formats: [:json], locals: { foo: @bar }
end
```

Everything goes fine in most cases, the template renders and I'm getting a string of json — exactly what I want.

But when there is an exception in the json template, funny things start to happen. Basically, I'm seeing this description: 

```
Missing partial /my_json_partial with {:locale=>[:en], :formats=>[:html], :handlers=>[:erb, :builder, :jbuilder, :coffee]}. Searched in:
  * "/my/app/views"
```

I've looked into actionpack in attempt to understand what's going on and here's what I've found.

The code goes into [render method](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.2.9/actionpack/lib/action_view/template.rb#L142) then the error actually happens and gets rescued by [handle_render_error ](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.2.9/actionpack/lib/action_view/template.rb#L310) method.

And then it comes to [refresh](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.2.9/actionpack/lib/action_view/template.rb#L163) method that actually tries to reload the broken template. Doing so, it completely ignores original template format and handler, trying to use view's defaults, therefore failing and showing completely unrelevant exception.

title: ActionView::Template#refresh fails to reload the template to render the error
body:
I'm trying to render a json/jbuilder template inside of a regular html template. Here is the code of the helper I'm using

```ruby
def get_some_json_stuff
   render partial: 'my_json_partial', handler: [:jbuilder], formats: [:json], locals: { foo: @bar }
end
```

Everything goes fine in most cases, the template renders and I'm getting a string of json — exactly what I want.

But when there is an exception in the json template, funny things start to happen. Basically, I'm seeing this description: 

```
Missing partial /my_json_partial with {:locale=>[:en], :formats=>[:html], :handlers=>[:erb, :builder, :jbuilder, :coffee]}. Searched in:
  * "/my/app/views"
```

I've looked into actionpack in attempt to understand what's going on and here's what I've found.

The code goes into [render method](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.2.9/actionpack/lib/action_view/template.rb#L142) then the error actually happens and gets rescued by [handle_render_error ](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.2.9/actionpack/lib/action_view/template.rb#L310) method.

And then it comes to [refresh](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.2.9/actionpack/lib/action_view/template.rb#L163) method that actually tries to reload the broken template. Doing so, it completely ignores original template format and handler, trying to use view's defaults, therefore failing and showing completely unrelevant exception.

title: handled respond_to? with private methods
body: ruby-2.0.0preview2 or later changed Object#initialize_dup to private method. I fixed Object#respond_to? works with private method.

title: Filter redirects
body:
Given the latest discussion on rails-core google group, rather than just discussing this one I'm providing working code. I think Rails is missing a way to filter redirect logs. It makes sense to me, given redirect logs could hold sensible informations the same way POST params do. 
The typical example is when you redirect to S3 signed URLs, which is my case. People is sending out logs to third party services for analysis, this feature will at least give them a way to have more control over what they send.

I was thinking about a way to make a gem out of it, but I seems that the current implementation does not leave room for anything to plug other than a monkeypatch. Advices on how to make a gem for this are of welcome of course.

title: Do not instantiate intermediate AR objects when eager loading.
body:
There are eager-loading queries that Active Record performs in two steps.

1. Fetch the ID of the relevant records
1. Perform the actual select to instantiate AR objects

Currently step one also instantiated intermediate ActiveRecord objects just to pick the ID from them. This changes fetches the IDs using `select_all`, which does not instante objects.

The intermediate objects were a problem because the `after_find` callback was triggered twice. Also I think it does not make sense to instantiate objects that we don't actually need.

This is a fix for #3313

I'm not sure if my test-case is very helpful. It was the best I could come up with to illustrate the problem.

title: More descriptive error when rendering a partial with `:layout => true`
body:
This change was motivated by the stack trace from #8376. The error describes the problem poorly. Since calling `render` with `:layout => true` is valid for templates, I can see beginners making the mistake to make such a call to render a partial.

Since the `:layout` argument for partials must be a string, I made this explicit in the code. This raises more descriptive error messages when invalid arguments like `:layout => true` are passed.

title: Fixes has many through counter-cache bug
body:
This commit fixes reported issue #7630 in which counter caches were not being updated properly when replacing has_many_through relationships.

eg if `posts` have many `tags` through `taggings`

and I did:

```ruby
post = Post.create!
tag = post.tags.create!
tag.posts = []
```

then it was: `post.reload.taggings_count == 1`

this pull makes it: `post.reload.taggings_count == 0`

title: Add metadata to schema_migrations table
body: This change adds three metadata columns to the schema_migrations table. The name and migrated_at (timestamp) columns will aid in diagnosis of problems related to running migrations and schema changes. The fingerprint column is in preparation for a future change that will detect when migrations are changed after they have already been run.

title: ActiveModel::Errors spec fixes
body:
Just small fixes in two tests for `ActiveModel::Errors`:

* `full_messages` test was calling `to_a`. The latter just calls the former, but since there are separate tests for each, they should call the right method.

* The test for `#add` defaulting to `:invalid` was actually passing `:invalid` as an argument, and so it was not actually  testing the default value.

title: Quote ~ in git config global excludes command.
body:
This will put ~/ in .gitconfig so it will not be hardcoded to the home
directory where the command was run.

title: Use attr_accessor for Rails.{application,cache,logger}
